dt: {bc}to hit (a golf ball or shot) with the extreme heel of the club so that the ball goes off in an unintended direction
{bc}to kick (a football) in an unintended direction

shortdef: to hit (a golf ball or shot) with the extreme heel of the club so that the ball goes off in an unintended direction; also : to kick (a football) in an unintended direction

dt: {bc}the part of the leg between the knee and the ankle in humans or the corresponding part in various other vertebrates
{bc}a cut of beef, veal, mutton, or lamb from the upper or the lower part of the leg {bc}{sx|shin||} {dx}see {dxt|beef|beef|illustration}{/dx}
{bc}a straight narrow usually essential part of an object: such as
{bc}the straight part of a nail or pin
{bc}the part of an anchor between the ring and the crown {dx}see {dxt|anchor|anchor|illustration}{/dx}
{bc}the part of a fishhook between the eye and the bend
{bc}the part of a key between the handle and the bit
{bc}the stem of a tobacco pipe or the part between the stem and the bowl
{bc}the narrow part of the sole of a shoe beneath the instep
{bc}a part of an object by which it can be attached: such as
{bc}a projection on the back of a solid button
{bc}a short stem of thread that holds a sewn button away from the cloth
{bc}the end (as of a drill bit) that is gripped in a chuck
{bc}the latter part of a period of time
{bc}the early or main part of a period of time

dt.t: 11 p.m. on the East coast is merely the {wi}shank{/wi} of the evening on the West coast

et: Middle English {it}shanke{/it}, from Old English {it}scanca{/it}; akin to Old Norse {it}skakkr{/it} crooked, Greek {it}skazein{/it} to limp
shortdef: the part of the leg between the knee and the ankle in humans or the corresponding part in various other vertebrates
a cut of beef, veal, mutton, or lamb from the upper or the lower part of the leg : shin
